neighbors.name: Brenda Sue Kendrick
neighbors.claims: Brenda Sue Kendrick is listed as an owner of property in Kansas City, Kansas, according to county land records ([appr.wycokck.org](https://appr.wycokck.org/Property-Detail/PropertyQuickRefID/R59670/PartyQuickRefID/crc32#:~:text=Ref%20ID%20Parcel%20ID%20Owner,AVE%2C%20Kansas%20City%2C%20KS%2066105)). She has not been identified in any local news or public meeting records taking a stance on development or energy issues ([wyandotteonline.com](https://wyandotteonline.com/category/opinions/page/71/#:~:text=Opinions%20%E2%80%93%20Page%2071%20%E2%80%93,50%20persons%20crowded%20into%20a)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with respect for her privacy and property rights. Emphasize listening to any concerns she has about her land and reassure that her interests will be taken into account.

neighbors.name: Jessica L. Mazur & Austin Mazur
neighbors.claims: Jessica and Austin Mazur are a young couple residing in Kansas City, Kansas ([my.babylist.com](https://my.babylist.com/baby-registry-jessica-mazur#:~:text=Jessica%20%26%20Austin%20Mazur)). Austin Mazur operates a local home remodeling business, Mazur Renovation, serving the Kansas City metro area ([mazurrenovationjoc.wixsite.com](https://mazurrenovationjoc.wixsite.com/home#:~:text=Mazur%20Renovation%20is%20a%20modest,finishing%20details%20in%20the%20home)) ([mazurrenovationjoc.wixsite.com](https://mazurrenovationjoc.wixsite.com/home#:~:text=%E2%80%9CMAZUR%20RENOVATION%20HAS%20DONE%20SEVERAL,WITH%20KNOWLEDGE%2C%20EXCELLENCE%20AND%20PROFESSIONALISM)). They have no public record of statements or activism regarding development or energy projects in Wyandotte County ([wyandotteonline.com](https://wyandotteonline.com/category/news-stories/page/214/#:~:text=UG%20Commission%20overrides%20mayor%E2%80%99s%20veto,resolution%20to%20exceed%20the%20revenue)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small business owners; no civic posts

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect through community pride and home value interests. A fellow community member or local business peer could discuss how the project might enhance the neighborhood and address any quality-of-life questions.

overview_summary: Both profiled neighbors have no clearly documented stance on local development or energy projects, with neither openly supporting nor opposing such initiatives. Each appears to have a limited public profile and low community influence, as neither holds formal leadership roles or has a history of civic activism in Wyandotte County.
